Class UXUtil

java.lang.Object
Utils.UXUtil
public class UXUtil extends Object
A Convenience class for initializing various GUI elements

      public static void initAppointmentWidget(javafx.scene.control.DatePicker dp, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox hour, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox minute, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox amPm)
      Initializes a multi component date picker
      Parameters:
      dp - - A Calendar date picker
      hour - - a ComboBox containing the list of hours 1-12
      minute - - A ComboBox containing [0, 15, 30, 45]
      amPm - - A ComboBox containing ["AM", "PM"]

    • initDatePicker

      public static void initDatePicker(javafx.scene.control.DatePicker dp)
      Initializes calendar date pickers so that the user cannot type into the text field, which can cause an exception if the user enters an invalid string. For convenience, we just disable text input instead of writing Error checking code for the text field.
      Parameters:
      dp - - Calendar date picker

    • initDivisionIdComboBox

      public static void initDivisionIdComboBox(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox cb, String countryString)
      Initilizes a ComboBox with the set of all Divisions available in the database. This combobox can only be initialized AFTER country is chosen, so that the divisions are a proper match with the country selected. This makes sure that the Customer cannot select country "Scotland" and Division "Texas" because Texas does not exist in the country of Scotland, it exists only in the United States, and so the country "U.S" must be selected before the Division "Texas" can be seen and selected in the Division ComboBox.
      Parameters:
      cb - - ComboBox to be initialized
      countryString - - Selected Country from another ComboBox.

    • initUserIDComboBox

      public static void initUserIDComboBox(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox cb)
      Initializes a ComboBox with the set of all users from the database with a string contraining first the user id, followed by a colon, followed by the user name, eg. "1: myUsername1", "2: jdoe123" etc.
      Parameters:
      cb - - ComboBox to be initialized

    • initContactIDComboBox

      Initilizes a ComboBox with the set of all Contacts from the database.
      Parameters:
      cb - - ComboBox to be initialized

    • getSelectionFromComboBox

      public static Boolean getSelectionFromComboBox(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox cb, javafx.scene.control.Label lbl, String lblText)
      returns false if anything doesn't check out, returns true when it's safe to accept the customer being added or modified. When the user clicks ok, we get the selection from the customer id combobox. There must be a selection if we are trying to add to the database. If user just hit cancel, this doesn't matter. Takes a reference to the customer id combo box itself and the customer id combobox label as well. When something is bad, we also set the text for the label as well as return false.
      Parameters:
      cb - - combobox we are getting the selection from
      lbl - - label attached to that combobox we can update with error messages
      lblText - - text string to set the label to if value is invalid and we need to show red error message
      Returns:
      - true if combobox was not empty and had valid input, false if combobox was empty or had invalid input

    • getIdNumberFromComboBox

      public static int getIdNumberFromComboBox(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox cb)
      Returns the id number of the selected value string of the ComboBox passed in. For example, if the string of the selected value is "1: John Doe" this function will return the number. A string value of "23: Jane Doe" would return the number 23 and so on.
      Parameters:
      cb - - ComboBox to get the select value id integer from
      Returns:
      - integer value extracted from the string of the selected value of the ComboBox passed in

    • getStringFromComboBox

      public static String getStringFromComboBox(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox cb) throws Exception
      Returns the string component of the selected value string of the ComboBox passed in. For example, if the string of the selected value is "1: John Doe" this function will return the string "John Doe". A String value of "23: Jane Doe" would return the string "Jane Doe" and so on.
      Parameters:
      cb - - ComboBox to get the string component from
      Returns:
      - String value extracted from the string of the selected value of the ComboBox passed in
      Throws:
      Exception - - throws exception for strings that are not formatted as such "1: Example1", "2: Example2" and so on. A string with value "John Doe" will throw an exception because it does not start with a number followed by a colon. A correct string would look like: "1: John Doe", "2: John Doe" etc.

    • setErrorLabel

      public static void setErrorLabel(javafx.scene.control.Label label)
      Sets a Label to show red text with the message "Cannot be empty"
      Parameters:
      label - - Label to set to the red text and set the message "Cannot be empty" Handy for informing the user that s/he/they left a text field empty
